Comments_List: I learned about many case precedents that led up to where our criminal justice system is today.

Through the class discussion the teacher got everyone to say their own ideas, which I think helped me to develop a bit of debating skills. It was very interesting to see different case studies and reading all the different theories.
different perspective to understand the criminal justice system
Law and its philosophy and its history.
I learned about political sciences and philosophy about crimes and punishments. I developed the skill of reading fast and effectively noting down key information.
Our professor did not really engage students to participate in class discussions. The class atmosphere felt really dry.
Have a debate on some of the hard case studies, I think it will help to better understand the case.
This course highly relies on preparation before class. It can be improved if the discussions in class get deeper into the materials.
Yes because this is a different kind of experience, I think this is partially because I am still in high school.
Probably not. The workload is too great and the course is pretty hard for students who haven't taken criminal law or philosophy courses.
I would recommend this course to any who likes political science or political philosophy because they can engage in intense discussion in this course about related topics.
